paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Tenthredo melanalis
Lepeletier 1823: 115
(unnecessary new replacement name for
analis Fabricius
), thought to be preoccupied by
Tenthredo analis Fabricius 1793
).

Stromboceros brevispinis
Konow 1908: 155
; Oehlke and Wudowenz 1984:371 . n. syn.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Two specimens of
H. analis
with type labels are in the Fabricius Collection at the NHMD. The specimen with the locality and name label has the abdomen missing; the other specimen is in good condition. Both specimens are the same species. The specimen in good condition is here designated the
Lectotype
, and the damaged specimen is a
Paralectotype
. The lectotype has only a green square paper and “TYPE” on red label. The paralectotype has a small piece of green square paper, “TYPE,” “ Essequibo , Schmidt, Mus. Jeg [?} Luna,
Hylotoma analis Fabr.
,” “
Stromoceros analis
F., Malaise det. 1937.”

Konow described
S. brevispinis
from both sexes from “Para Teffe, Oyapock, Tabatinga, R. Japura.” He did not designate a holotype and did not state how many specimens he had. One female and seven males labelled type are at SDEI. A male labelled “Oyapock, 6.6.1904 , Ducke,” “Coll. Konow,” “TYPE,” “
Stromboceros brevispinis Knw.
, Para” is hereby designated the
Lectotype
. The other specimens are
Paralectotypes
: two males with same data but without determination labels; one male from “Tabatinga”; two males from “R. Japura,” one male from “ Brasil , Para”; and one female from “Teffe.” All appear to be the same as
P. analis
. The amount of black on the mesosternum varies from none to almost all black.

Cameron (1911) described
Monophadnus trichiotomus
from a female from British Guiana . The holotype at BMNH is labelled “
Monophadnus triciotomus Cam.
, Type., Br. Guyana ,” “647,” “P. Cameron coll., 1914-110,” is in the BMNH. It is not in the type catalog at BMNH.

Forsius (1925) described
Romaniola amazonica
from a female from “ Manaos .” The holotype at NHRS is labelled “Amazon Roman,” “Manos,” “Nov.” “TYPUS,” “
Romaniola
n. g.
amazonica
n. sp. Typ. F. R. Forsius det.,” “243 75,” “Riksmuseum Stockholm .”
